page.title: 06Inchnadamph Church
page.content: Inchnadamph church was perhaps built in{1835.}It has changed little since then. The walls outside are harled stone and inside is wood lined and lathe and plaster. On top, is a tiny spire with a weather vane. It has plain dormer windows at one side only except for a little vestry window. It has no electricity or water. In the graveyard is the{ancient tomb of the {Macleod family}which was built in the middle of the{15th Century by Angus, great-grandson of the first laird as a penance for burning down a previous shrine. The first protestant minister was{William Gray,in 1576.}The church is sadly no longer used. A new {Parish church}was built in{Lochinver in 1903.Old Gaelic bibles and comment- aries are still to be found inside. The graveyard is rarely used for burials now due to high soil acidity.}
